passage_text: Wolf Blitzer is a Republican, and a conservative Republican at that. I know his former producer and several others who know him as a colleague. His personal views skew very much to the right, which doesn't stop him from doing his job in a relatively balanced manner.
In this Nov. 15, 2007 file photo, CNN anchor Wolf Blitzer moderates a debate among Democratic presidential hopefuls at the University of Nevada in Las Vegas, Nev.

About. Wolf Blitzer is CNN's lead political anchor and the anchor of The Situation Room with Wolf Blitzer, which airs weekdays at 5 p.m. ET, providing viewers with in-depth reports about the political, international and breaking news stories of the day.

Wolf Blitzer was born on March 22, 1948 in Augsburg, Germany as Wolf Isaac Blitzer. He is an actor, known for CNN Nevada Democratic Party Presidential Primary Debate (2007), The California Democratic Debate (2008) and Jimmy Carter Man from Plains (2007). He has been married to Lynn Greenfield since 1973.

Benghazi committee Democrat defends Hillary Clinton.
